issue.title: Update to log4j 2.19.0
issue.body:
this is a possible method to remove log4j jars from the resulting build

I ran 

```
./apollo deploy
cd target
mkdir output
cp apollo-2.6.7-SNAPSHOT.war output/apollo.zip
cd output
unzip apollo.zip
find .|grep log4j
```

output

```
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-1.2-api-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-api-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-core-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/tomcat-embed-logging-log4j-7.0.70.jar
```

these are up to date versions of log4j v2

I then deployed this war file and it did not crash on startup

issue.title: Fix typos in codebase using typos-cli
issue.body:
Uses https://github.com/crate-ci/typos

It is impressively good at finding typos in variable names and prose

This also adds a github action for this check. A .ignore file specifies a list of files to ignore, not able to ignore a single line for now, but pretty much checks and fixes the whole codebase by running `typos --write-changes` in root dir

issue.title: Echo user locations over websockets

milestone.title: December 2022
milestone.description:
##### UI Milestones
- Apollo annotation track supports horizontal flipping
- Multiple user logins and passwords
- Can connect to multiple Apollo collaboration servers
- Backend now supports multiple users, not hardcoded
- The different roles (admin, user, readOnly) are still hardcoded.
- Each user sees updates being made by other users in real time
- See user information when viewing Change Log
##### Technical Milestones
- Multiple Apollo Internet Accounts
- Using Websockets for pushing updates from server to multiple clients
- Echoing changes from one user in the the collaboration server to other users
- Collaboration server integrating with LDAP for user authentication, not necessarily offering management interface, not using LDAP for authorization unless via a Validation. Remember, in Apollo land, authorization is a special case of Validation.

issue.body:
When a user opens a particular area in an Apollo track, or navigates around an Apollo track, the client will send the current area (possible debounced) to the collaboration server.

The server will then echo that location to all other clients (not storing it anywhere).

Also, when a user first logs in, it will send a message to the collaboration server that is echoed out, and all other clients will then send their current locations so the new user can get its record of where other users are initialized.

comment.body:
This sounds like a good design. We will see if the re-echoing on login
results in too much message traffic. If it does, we can store last known
locations on the server. But we probably don’t need to worry about that
yet.

issue.title: Google analytics needs to be updated
issue.body:
JBrowse 2 (and 1) currently use Google's Universal Analytics (you can tell by the UA prefix on the user below), which will [stop working on July 1, 2023](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/11583528).

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/f709d70e1618e600c2160e639378e73ffa37f1ec/packages/core/util/analytics.ts#L87

In order to keep using Google Analytics, we'll have to migrate to [Google Analytics 4](https://support.google.com/analytics/?hl=en#topic=10737980).

issue.title: Add ability to open a synteny track directly from the dotplot/linear synteny view import forms
issue.body:
Possible fix for https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/3079

Creates a rudimentary "tracklist" that shows session tracks and config tracks (not connection yet) at the synteny import form, helping users to more easily launch a synteny view

Will look for track types that contain the word 'Synteny' (in case another synteny track type is developed), and check that the track's assemblyNames matches **both** of the user selected assemblies

Makes it easier for the user to see that "opening their own track" is an optional step too

issue.title: Allow disabling derives from references
issue.body:
This option allows fully disabling derives from reference resolving. This is an alternative to https://github.com/GMOD/gff-js/pull/56 that just disables the resolution of Derives_from entries

I would probably suggest turning it on by default in jbrowse 2

comment.body: I like this approach better than the one in #56. This change here is smaller, and is more explicit that this is *disabling* support for part of the GFF3 spec.

pull_request.title: Add infrastructure for creating linear-genome-view sub-classes
pull_request.body:
Re-works some components and exposes others such that the linear genome view plugin can be used / manipulated more easily by external plugins (i.e. the [multilevel-linear-view](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-multilevel-linear-view).

In this PR:
- adds the 'extendedName' property to the ViewTypes constructor
**This is required to extend a view type, even when using .named() to extend a view type. This is because when the PluginManager is looping through _displays_ each display has an associated view type. If that view type has already had tracks loaded through it, it ignores the duplicates. An extended view type appears as a duplicate here and without this optional property on view types, the tracks are empty for an extended view, even though it should be able to display all the tracks of its parent / extendee view.**
- modifies some logic to display / not display a header and the minicontrols to better synergize with providing a custom header or custom minicontrols component
- adds ZoomControls, SearchBox, and LinearGenomeView components to those exported by plugin-linear-genome-view

issue.title: Add ability to customize About dialog with callbacks and optionally hide links to data
issue.body:
Adds a `formatAbout` config subschema similar to `formatDetails`

`formatAbout` can be applied per track or at the entire jbrowse config level (so you can add hideUris to the entire jbrowse config)

- The `formatAbout` subschema has a `hideUris` slot to hide the rendering of "UriLocation" objects in the about dialog. Note that the `hideUris` results in the "Copy config" button getting hidden too, since copying to text would reveal this type of hidden info...


- The `formatAbout` subschema also has a `conf` slot to add arbitrary jexl callbacks to the display of the conf object in the about dialog



Possible fix for https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/3213

Rider change: makes a getTrackName utility function that computes the track name (the logic for making the "reference sequence track name" was duplicated in several places)

issue.title: improve plugin failure modes and development experience
issue.body:
If something goes wrong when using a plugin, you can lose your entire session, which can be a large setback.

For example, if it can't find a track type, it doesn't just not load that track, the whole browser fails to load, and often spits out an error that is megabytes in size.

Some possible approaches:
* inspect configuration before loading into MST to try to catch common errors
** for data adapters and tracks that can't load, put in an "error" placeholder
* let MST try to load it, then inspect/postprocess the error that comes back to try to make it readable
* restructure the MST tree to be less monolithic in its structure, perhaps with MST references?

issue.title: Role based authorisation based on JWT access token
issue.body:
Implement NestJS role based authorisation based on the fact that authentication will provide JWT access token.

- There will be three hard coded roles: _admin_, _user_ and _read-only_
- The roles inherit as following:  _user_ role inherits _read-only_ role. And _admin_ inherits _user_ and _read-only_ roles.
- Each controller and endpoint may have their own role permissions
- Change controller must have an additional authorisation layer where each _changeType_ may have an own authorisation requirement. Additional authorisation roles are defined in _roles.changePermissions.ts_ where keys are possible change types and their values are _admin_, _user_ and _read-only_.
- Users and their roles will be saved in _Users_ collection where collection properties are: _ObjectId_, _id_, _username_, _email_, _roles_ and _timestamp_.

comment.body:
Don't forget that all authorizations are to be implemented as Validations.

issue.title: Update to log4j 2.19.0
issue.body:
this is a possible method to remove log4j jars from the resulting build

I ran 

```
./apollo deploy
cd target
mkdir output
cp apollo-2.6.7-SNAPSHOT.war output/apollo.zip
cd output
unzip apollo.zip
find .|grep log4j
```

output

```
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-1.2-api-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-api-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-core-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/tomcat-embed-logging-log4j-7.0.70.jar
```

these are up to date versions of log4j v2

I then deployed this war file and it did not crash on startup

issue.title: Echo user locations over websockets

milestone.title: December 2022
milestone.description:
##### UI Milestones
- Apollo annotation track supports horizontal flipping
- Multiple user logins and passwords
- Can connect to multiple Apollo collaboration servers
- Backend now supports multiple users, not hardcoded
- The different roles (admin, user, readOnly) are still hardcoded.
- Each user sees updates being made by other users in real time
- See user information when viewing Change Log
##### Technical Milestones
- Multiple Apollo Internet Accounts
- Using Websockets for pushing updates from server to multiple clients
- Echoing changes from one user in the the collaboration server to other users
- Collaboration server integrating with LDAP for user authentication, not necessarily offering management interface, not using LDAP for authorization unless via a Validation. Remember, in Apollo land, authorization is a special case of Validation.

issue.body:
When a user opens a particular area in an Apollo track, or navigates around an Apollo track, the client will send the current area (possible debounced) to the collaboration server.

The server will then echo that location to all other clients (not storing it anywhere).

Also, when a user first logs in, it will send a message to the collaboration server that is echoed out, and all other clients will then send their current locations so the new user can get its record of where other users are initialized.

comment.body:
This sounds like a good design. We will see if the re-echoing on login
results in too much message traffic. If it does, we can store last known
locations on the server. But we probably don’t need to worry about that
yet.

wrote:

JBrowse 2 (and 1) currently use Google's Universal Analytics (you can tell by the UA prefix on the user below), which will [stop working on July 1, 2023](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/11583528).

pull_request.title: Add infrastructure for creating linear-genome-view sub-classes
pull_request.body:
Re-works some components and exposes others such that the linear genome view plugin can be used / manipulated more easily by external plugins (i.e. the [multilevel-linear-view](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-multilevel-linear-view).

In this PR:
- adds the 'extendedName' property to the ViewTypes constructor
**This is required to extend a view type, even when using .named() to extend a view type. This is because when the PluginManager is looping through _displays_ each display has an associated view type. If that view type has already had tracks loaded through it, it ignores the duplicates. An extended view type appears as a duplicate here and without this optional property on view types, the tracks are empty for an extended view, even though it should be able to display all the tracks of its parent / extendee view.**
- modifies some logic to display / not display a header and the minicontrols to better synergize with providing a custom header or custom minicontrols component
- adds ZoomControls, SearchBox, and LinearGenomeView components to those exported by plugin-linear-genome-view

issue.title: Add ability to customize About dialog with callbacks and optionally hide links to data
issue.body:
Adds a `formatAbout` config subschema similar to `formatDetails`

`formatAbout` can be applied per track or at the entire jbrowse config level (so you can add hideUris to the entire jbrowse config)

- The `formatAbout` subschema has a `hideUris` slot to hide the rendering of "UriLocation" objects in the about dialog. Note that the `hideUris` results in the "Copy config" button getting hidden too, since copying to text would reveal this type of hidden info...


- The `formatAbout` subschema also has a `conf` slot to add arbitrary jexl callbacks to the display of the conf object in the about dialog



Possible fix for https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/3213

Rider change: makes a getTrackName utility function that computes the track name (the logic for making the "reference sequence track name" was duplicated in several places)

issue.title: improve plugin failure modes and development experience
issue.body:
If something goes wrong when using a plugin, you can lose your entire session, which can be a large setback.

For example, if it can't find a track type, it doesn't just not load that track, the whole browser fails to load, and often spits out an error that is megabytes in size.

Some possible approaches:
* inspect configuration before loading into MST to try to catch common errors
** for data adapters and tracks that can't load, put in an "error" placeholder
* let MST try to load it, then inspect/postprocess the error that comes back to try to make it readable
* restructure the MST tree to be less monolithic in its structure, perhaps with MST references?

issue.title: Role based authorisation based on JWT access token
issue.body:
Implement NestJS role based authorisation based on the fact that authentication will provide JWT access token.

- There will be three hard coded roles: _admin_, _user_ and _read-only_
- The roles inherit as following:  _user_ role inherits _read-only_ role. And _admin_ inherits _user_ and _read-only_ roles.
- Each controller and endpoint may have their own role permissions
- Change controller must have an additional authorisation layer where each _changeType_ may have an own authorisation requirement. Additional authorisation roles are defined in _roles.changePermissions.ts_ where keys are possible change types and their values are _admin_, _user_ and _read-only_.
- Users and their roles will be saved in _Users_ collection where collection properties are: _ObjectId_, _id_, _username_, _email_, _roles_ and _timestamp_.

comment.body:
Don't forget that all authorizations are to be implemented as Validations.

issue.title: Update to log4j 2.19.0
issue.body:
this is a possible method to remove log4j jars from the resulting build

I ran 

```
./apollo deploy
cd target
mkdir output
cp apollo-2.6.7-SNAPSHOT.war output/apollo.zip
cd output
unzip apollo.zip
find .|grep log4j
```

output

```
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-1.2-api-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-api-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/log4j-core-2.19.0.jar
WEB-INF/lib/tomcat-embed-logging-log4j-7.0.70.jar
```

these are up to date versions of log4j v2

I then deployed this war file and it did not crash on startup

issue.title: Echo user locations over websockets

milestone.title: December 2022
milestone.description:
##### UI Milestones
- Apollo annotation track supports horizontal flipping
- Multiple user logins and passwords
- Can connect to multiple Apollo collaboration servers
- Backend now supports multiple users, not hardcoded
- The different roles (admin, user, readOnly) are still hardcoded.
- Each user sees updates being made by other users in real time
- See user information when viewing Change Log
##### Technical Milestones
- Multiple Apollo Internet Accounts
- Using Websockets for pushing updates from server to multiple clients
- Echoing changes from one user in the the collaboration server to other users
- Collaboration server integrating with LDAP for user authentication, not necessarily offering management interface, not using LDAP for authorization unless via a Validation. Remember, in Apollo land, authorization is a special case of Validation.

issue.body:
When a user opens a particular area in an Apollo track, or navigates around an Apollo track, the client will send the current area (possible debounced) to the collaboration server.

The server will then echo that location to all other clients (not storing it anywhere).

Also, when a user first logs in, it will send a message to the collaboration server that is echoed out, and all other clients will then send their current locations so the new user can get its record of where other users are initialized.

comment.body:
This sounds like a good design. We will see if the re-echoing on login
results in too much message traffic. If it does, we can store last known
locations on the server. But we probably don’t need to worry about that
yet.

issue.title: Google analytics needs to be updated
issue.body:
JBrowse 2 (and 1) currently use Google's Universal Analytics (you can tell by the UA prefix on the user below), which will [stop working on July 1, 2023](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/11583528).

https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/blob/f709d70e1618e600c2160e639378e73ffa37f1ec/packages/core/util/analytics.ts#L87

In order to keep using Google Analytics, we'll have to migrate to [Google Analytics 4](https://support.google.com/analytics/?hl=en#topic=10737980).

+    this.extendedName = stuff.extendedName ? stuff.extendedName : undefined

pull_request.title: Add infrastructure for creating linear-genome-view sub-classes
pull_request.body:
Re-works some components and exposes others such that the linear genome view plugin can be used / manipulated more easily by external plugins (i.e. the [multilevel-linear-view](https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-plugin-multilevel-linear-view).

In this PR:
- adds the 'extendedName' property to the ViewTypes constructor
**This is required to extend a view type, even when using .named() to extend a view type. This is because when the PluginManager is looping through _displays_ each display has an associated view type. If that view type has already had tracks loaded through it, it ignores the duplicates. An extended view type appears as a duplicate here and without this optional property on view types, the tracks are empty for an extended view, even though it should be able to display all the tracks of its parent / extendee view.**
- modifies some logic to display / not display a header and the minicontrols to better synergize with providing a custom header or custom minicontrols component
- adds ZoomControls, SearchBox, and LinearGenomeView components to those exported by plugin-linear-genome-view

issue.title: Add ability to customize About dialog with callbacks and optionally hide links to data
issue.body:
Adds a `formatAbout` config subschema similar to `formatDetails`

`formatAbout` can be applied per track or at the entire jbrowse config level (so you can add hideUris to the entire jbrowse config)

- The `formatAbout` subschema has a `hideUris` slot to hide the rendering of "UriLocation" objects in the about dialog. Note that the `hideUris` results in the "Copy config" button getting hidden too, since copying to text would reveal this type of hidden info...


- The `formatAbout` subschema also has a `conf` slot to add arbitrary jexl callbacks to the display of the conf object in the about dialog



Possible fix for https://github.com/GMOD/jbrowse-components/issues/3213

Rider change: makes a getTrackName utility function that computes the track name (the logic for making the "reference sequence track name" was duplicated in several places)

issue.title: improve plugin failure modes and development experience
issue.body:
If something goes wrong when using a plugin, you can lose your entire session, which can be a large setback.

For example, if it can't find a track type, it doesn't just not load that track, the whole browser fails to load, and often spits out an error that is megabytes in size.

Some possible approaches:
* inspect configuration before loading into MST to try to catch common errors
** for data adapters and tracks that can't load, put in an "error" placeholder
* let MST try to load it, then inspect/postprocess the error that comes back to try to make it readable
* restructure the MST tree to be less monolithic in its structure, perhaps with MST references?

issue.title: Role based authorisation based on JWT access token
issue.body:
Implement NestJS role based authorisation based on the fact that authentication will provide JWT access token.

- There will be three hard coded roles: _admin_, _user_ and _read-only_
- The roles inherit as following:  _user_ role inherits _read-only_ role. And _admin_ inherits _user_ and _read-only_ roles.
- Each controller and endpoint may have their own role permissions
- Change controller must have an additional authorisation layer where each _changeType_ may have an own authorisation requirement. Additional authorisation roles are defined in _roles.changePermissions.ts_ where keys are possible change types and their values are _admin_, _user_ and _read-only_.
- Users and their roles will be saved in _Users_ collection where collection properties are: _ObjectId_, _id_, _username_, _email_, _roles_ and _timestamp_.

comment.body:
Don't forget that all authorizations are to be implemented as Validations.
